messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE FILE: #G-1175-RS DATE: 11/20/28  On the night of November 20, a series of coordinated thefts occurred in several upscale neighborhoods. The perpetrators targeted luxury homes, making away with high-value items, including jewelry, art pieces, and cash. Given the precision and speed of the heists, it was clear that this was the work of a well-organized gang. A special task force was assembled to delve into these sophisticated thefts.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  INITIAL REPORTS: Patrol Officer B. C. D. Fletcher was on routine patrol when he responded to the first alarm, gathering preliminary details from the affected residents. THEFT ANALYSIS: Detective E. F. G. Moreno and Detective H. I. J. Knight were brought in to piece together the patterns of the thefts, hypothesizing about potential next targets. FORENSIC EVIDENCE: Criminalist K. L. M. Stark was dispatched to the crime scenes to collect and analyze fingerprints, footprints, and other trace evidence. SURVEILLANCE: Captain N. O. P. Reynolds coordinated surveillance operations, deploying undercover units in areas deemed high-risk based on the detectives' analysis. WITNESS INTERVIEWS: Detective Q. R. S. Wu interviewed neighbors and potential witnesses, gathering descriptions and possible identifications of the culprits. SECURITY MEASURES: Patrol Officer T. U. V. Ellis worked with local neighborhood watches to increase vigilance and enhance security protocols. OPERATIONAL STRATEGY: Captain W. X. Y. Bennett developed an operational plan, strategizing on how best to catch the criminals in the act or trace them to their hideout. With the combined efforts of the task force, substantial leads were developed, and suspects were identified within a week. The insights from Detectives Moreno, Knight, and Wu were crucial, while the strategy formulated by Captains Reynolds and Bennett showed promise.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.
